text: John W. Douglass was a Commissioner of Internal Revenue at the Internal Revenue Service in the United States. His state was Pennsylvania. Douglass served as acting IRS Commissioner from November 1, 1870 to January 2, 1871 and as IRS Commissioner from August 9, 1871 to May 14, 1875. == References == Category:Commissioners of Internal Revenue Category:Grant administration personnel Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: John W. Douglass (IRS Commissioner)
